column4: What command will take me out of X and drop me back to the command line?
/etc/init.d/gdm stop
thanks
with sudo
if you haven't created an xorg.conf, you won't have any
deactivate the nvidia driver from teh jockey menu "hardwa drivers"
if it works with nouvaeu, write a bug report ;)
If I could get to the GUI menu to do that I wouldn't have any problems ;)
I thought you had a running GNOME and want a terminal???
No, X wouldn't get past the Mythbuntu herringbone pattern and Ctl Alt F1 showed a blank screen
ah, I see. Then boot into maintenance mode and do sudo apt-get remove --purge nvidia-current
E: Couldn't find package nvidia-current   Should I uninstall all of them or just the latest?  thanks
dpkg -l | grep nvidia
Do I want to remove nvidia-modaliases
have you solved your problem?
No.  I was able to completely remove the nvidia drivers and start x with nv driver.  When I put the nvidia drivers back on I'm once again frozen at the Mythbuntu herringbone screen.
Thanks for getting back to me
seems you've found a bug...
I'm trying to remove my xorg.conf and restart now
OK
I got X started, but dialog boxes have no window bar on top with close/max/min buttons etc.  What can cause that?
so, evereything works with env drivers, but not with NDvidia?
does an xorg.conf exist?
